error.signature: EventBridge rule is in DISABLED state and not triggering targets
error.regex: (Rule .+ is (DISABLED|disabled)|Events are not being delivered|No invocations for rule)

verdict.summary: EventBridge rule is disabled or event pattern does not match incoming events, so targets are never invoked.

dead_ends.action: Create a duplicate rule instead of fixing the existing one
dead_ends.why_fails: If the event pattern is wrong, the duplicate will have the same issue; also creates management overhead

dead_ends.action: Check CloudWatch Logs without verifying the rule state first
dead_ends.why_fails: If the rule is disabled, no events are processed and there will be nothing in logs to find

workarounds.action: Enable the rule and verify the event pattern matches incoming events
workarounds.how: aws events enable-rule --name RULE_NAME && aws events test-event-pattern --event-pattern PATTERN --event EVENT_JSON

workarounds.action: Verify the target has a resource-based policy allowing EventBridge to invoke it
workarounds.how: For Lambda targets: aws lambda get-policy --function-name FUNC to verify events.amazonaws.com has invoke permission

preceded_by.condition: Permission errors during rule creation may leave rule in disabled state

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Step Functions timeout is about state machine execution duration; EventBridge rule disabled is about event routing not triggering
